day20.Title: AI for Economic Development and Social Good
day20.Name: Ashwini Vaishnaw, GoI
day20.name: Dr. Anshuman Awasthi, Mercedes-Benz Research & Development India Pvt. Ltd.
day20.name_1: Dr. Thomas Kuhn, Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering (IESE)
day20.name_2: H.E. Dr. Karsten Wildberger, Federal Ministry for Digital Transformation and Government Modernisation (BMDS)
day20.name_3: H.E. Dr. Philipp Wildberger, Embassy of the Federal Republic of Germany, New Delhi
day20.Description_1: This session will advance dialogue and collaboration among government, industry and the research community. It will explore AI's role in inclusive growth and sustainable innovation across manufacturing, agriculture, healthcare, and trustworthy AI. Featuring leadership talks, the session will convene leaders, policymakers, technologists and entrepreneurs to strengthen partnerships, promote R&D and accelerate responsible AI adoption.
day20.Description_4: Mr. Dattatri Salagame, Bosch Global Software Technologies

day20.Title: Democratizing AI Compute and Digital Data Infrastructures
day20.Name: Chenai Chair, Masakhane African Languages Hub
day20.name: Faith Waithaka, Africa Data Centres Association
day20.Description_1: This panel will examine how governments and partners can expand equitable access to the core enablers of AI ecosystems, particularly compute and digital data infrastructure to support inclusive, sustainable innovation. It will discuss practical models such as shared compute, regional infrastructure, and public–private partnerships, alongside investments in skills, data readiness, and governance. The panel will also explore cost-efficient AI approaches and strategies to reduce AI's environmental footprint through energy- and water-efficient infrastructure.

day20.Title: Building AI Readiness: From Compute to Capability
day20.Name: Dr. Paneerselvam M, Ministry of Electronics & IT
day20.name: Thomas Zacharia, AMD
day20.Description_1: The proliferation of Generative AI, driven by the advent of Large Language Models (LLMs), Visual Language Models (VLMs), and Agentic workflows, has fundamentally transformed the requirements for high-performance computing infrastructure. For the users of the IndiaAI compute portal and the broader ecosystem, the selection of Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) has evolved from a simple metric of peak floating-point performance (FLOPS) into a complex optimization challenge involving memory bandwidth, interconnect topology, and architectural specialization.

day20.Title: India's Path to an AGI-Enabling Ecosystem
day20.Name: Parth Sarthi, Gan Chariot
day20.name: Shri Ghanshyam Prasad, Central Electricity Authority, Ministry of Power and Ex-Officio Secretary to the Government of India
day20.name_1: Shri Tarun Dua ji, one of the impaneled CSPs for IndiaAI Mission
day20.Description_1:
This session brings together perspectives on what it takes to 
create an ecosystem capable of supporting frontier-scale AI research in 
India. Speakers from compute and energy infrastructure, academia and industry will discuss the conditions required for long-horizon research, 
large-scale experimentation and the development of all five layers of the AI 
infrastructure. The discussion will highlight how human capital 
development, strengthening science ecosystems, and democratizing AI resources will advance AI development in India.

day20.Title: AI-Ready Data: Shared Infrastructure for Innovation
day20.Name: Dr Debabrata Das, IIIT-Bangalore
day20.name: Dr. V K Paul, NITI Aayog, GoI
day20.Description_1: Data is the backbone of AI innovation. This session focuses on how interoperable, trustworthy, and consent-based data infrastructure can enable AI development while protecting user rights. Speakers will discuss governance frameworks, data-sharing models, and public–private collaboration approaches.

day20.Title: AI at the Core, 6G at the Edge: Designing India's Next Resilient, Innovative and Efficient Digital Frontier
day20.Name: Radhakant Das, Tata Consultancy Services
day20.name: Rajesh Kumar Pathak, Bharat 6G Alliance, New Delhi
day20.name_2: Sanjay Nekkanti, Dhruva Space Pvt. Ltd.
day20.Description_1: The panel discussion situates India's opportunity at the intersection of these two forces: AI providing cognition, autonomy, and predictive intelligence, while 6G provides real-time sensing, extreme reliability, and pervasive connectivity across terrestrial, aerial, maritime, and satellite systems. In this emerging paradigm, networks themselves become AI-native—the radio interface, the RAN, the core, and the edge begin to reason, adapt, self-organize, and optimize through multi-agent intelligence

day20.Title: Accelerating India's AI Growth – A Blueprint for India's AI Success
day20.Name: Hon'ble Shri Jayant Chaudhary Ji, GoI
day20.name: Manish Gupta, Dell Technologies India
day20.name_2: Rajgopal A S, NxtGen Cloud Technologies
day20.Description_1: This session will present a blueprint outlining priorities to support AI growth, including scaling infrastructure, building skills, enabling innovation, and strengthening governance frameworks. The discussion will bring together stakeholders to examine how such priorities can support AI readiness, economic development, and broader societal outcomes, with a focus on inclusive and sustainable adoption.

day20.Title: Scaling Human Potential in the Age of AI
day20.Name: Anurag Hoon, Manzil Mystics
day20.name: Archana Vemulapalli, Global Commercial Sales, AMD
day20.name_1: Kirthiga Reddy, OptimizeGeo and Founder, AI Kiran
day20.Description_1: AI is rapidly becoming a foundational layer across education, creativity, and enterprise. This session examines how human potential is shaped, scaled, or constrained by AI systems and what it takes to ensure these technologies expand capability rather than concentrate advantage. Leaders from automation, AI-driven enterprise, data ecosystems, global business, philanthropy, and the creative arts discuss where AI meaningfully augments human skill, and where intentional design is required to prevent new forms of exclusion.

day20.Title: The Innovation Beneath AI: The US-India Partnership powering the AI Era
day20.Name: Jeff Binder, TokenForm
day20.name: Prince Dhawan, REC Limited
day20.Description_1: AI is reshaping how infrastructure is being developed across areas such as energy, critical minerals, compute, and data centres. This session will examine emerging approaches to building the infrastructure required to support AI growth, including supply chain considerations, investment trends, and policy frameworks. The discussion will also explore how public and private sector actors can contribute to scalable and sustainable infrastructure development.

day20.Title: AI in Negotiations, Diplomacy, and Conflict Management
day20.Name: Carme Artigas, Belfer Center for  Science and International Affairs, High Commissioner Spain-India Dual Year for AI
day20.name: Gabriela Ramos, UNESCO
day20.name_1: J. Michael McQuade, HARVARD KENNEDY SCHOOL
day20.Description_1: AI research spans domains from scientific discovery to financial markets, yet attempts to develop, evaluate, and deploy AI in negotiations and diplomatic settings remain sparse. This session will examine efforts in the AI in Negotiation, Diplomacy, and Conflict Management (NDCM) space, urging participants to rethink these tools and imagine a future in which non-human intelligence plays a trusted role in international negotiations.
day20.Description_3: The Move37 Project at the Belfer Center for Science and International Affairs, Harvard Kennedy School

day20.Title: Governing Scientific AI at Scale: Safety, Evaluation, and Institutional Readiness
day20.Name: Dr. Geetha Raju, CeRAI - IIT Madras
day20.name: Dr. Shyam Krishna, RAND Europe
day20.name_1: Dr. Suryesh Kumar Namdeo, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore
day20.Description_1: As capabilities scale, existing assurance and risk management approaches are often stretched by real-world scientific and institutional contexts. This session examines how safety, evaluation, governance frameworks can be adapted and stress-tested through scientific AI use cases, and how emerging ecosystems can build evaluation capacity, manage high-impact risks, and contribute to globally robust scientific AI safety practices.

day20.Title: पढ़AI 2.0: Reimagining Indian Education System
day20.Name: Alondra Nelson, School of Social Science, Institute for Advanced Study
day20.name: Pankaj Arora, National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE)
day20.Description_1: This session explores a bold vision of education in the age of AI, moving beyond incremental adoption to reimagine entire learning ecosystems. Drawing on global ideas and international best practices, it treats AI as a transformative force shaping pedagogy, assessment, institutions, and educator roles. The discussion encourages imaginative, future-oriented thinking around learner-centric, inclusive, human-centred models that use AI to enable personalised learning, creativity, and lifelong learning at scale for learners, teachers, and systems worldwide, equitably.
day20.Description_3: Center of Policy Research and Governance

day20.Title: AI for Agriculture: Scaling Intelligence for Food and Climate Resilience
day20.Name: Abhishek Singh, MEITY and India AI Mission
day20.name: Devendra Fadnavis, Maharashtra
day20.name_1: Devesh Chaturvedi, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India
day20.name_2: Johannes Zutt, SARVP, World Bank Group
day20.Description_1: This session positions agriculture as a strategic application domain for Artificial Intelligence, aligned with India's national AI vision. Anchored by the Government of Maharashtra, it presents policy‑led, implementation‑ready AI models to strengthen food systems and climate resilience. The programme will feature a keynote address by the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Maharashtra, followed by a curated high‑level panel discussion and interactive Q&A, with participation from senior Government of India officials, global experts, and leading technology policymakers.
day20.Description_4: Shri. Vikas Chandra Rastogi, Government of Maharashtra
day20.Description_7: Soumya Swaminathan, M S Swaminathan Research Foundation

day20.Title: Welfare for All: Ensuring Equitable AI Growth Across the World's Largest and Oldest Democracies
day20.Name: Mr. Brad Staples, APCO Worldwide
day20.name: Mr. Julian Waits, Rapid7
day20.Description_1: This high-level panel will convene World's largest AI practitioners from Google, Apple, Microsoft, Dell, and others will explore how the world's biggest tech companies can work with governments to achieve democratic access to AI on a global scale. With India and the U.S. as democratic anchors, the session will highlight practical pathways to ensure AI-driven growth delivers broad-based welfare and equal opportunity for all.

day20.Title: Democratizing AI for Industry and Society
Developing Eastern India's Tech Hub
Keynote
day20.Name: Mathias Cormann, Secretary-General, OECD

day20.Title: Panel: Data Sovereignty
day20.Name: Sunil Gupta, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, Yotta Data Services
day20.name: Shikoh Gitau, Chief Executive Officer, Qhala
day20.name_1: Seema Ambastha, Chief Executive Officer, L&T Vyoma
day20.name_2: Moderator: Arghya Sengupta, Founder and Research Director, Vidhi Centre for Legal Policy

day20.Title: Leveraging the Bhashini Stack for the Parliament of India- Our Journey (Hosted by Bhashini)
day20.ROom: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
day20.Name: Sh. Amitabh Nag, CEO Digital India Bhashini Division,
day20.name: Dr. Kushal Pathak, Joint Secretary, Rajya Sabha
day20.name_1: Sh. Shailendra Pal Singh, Sr. Technical Solutions Manager BHASHINI
day20.name_2: Sh. Ajay Singh Rajawat, Sr. Manager BHASHINI
day20.Description_1: "Leveraging the Bhashini Stack for the Parliament of India – Our Journey" describes how India's multilingual AI platform, BHASHINI, has been applied to enhance parliamentary operations and accessibility. BHASHINI—an AI language stack developed under the National Language Translation Mission—powers Sansad Bhashini, enabling real‑time translation, transcription, and AI‑assisted tools for legislative debates, documents, and chatbot support. This journey highlights practical deployment of language AI to make parliamentary procedures more inclusive, efficient, and accessible across Indian languages.

day20.Title: Agentic AI Roundtable
day20.Name: Caroline Louveaux, Mastercard
day20.name: Daniel Castro, Information Technology and Innovation Foundation
day20.name_2: Jason Oxman, Information Technology Industry Council
day20.Description_1: This roundtable will convene senior industry leaders and government officials to examine governance, interoperability, and responsible deployment challenges posed by emerging agentic AI systems capable of autonomous decision-making and adaptive behaviour. Grounded in real-world use cases, the discussion will focus on cybersecurity, enterprise productivity, and autonomous systems. Participants will explore risk-based governance, secure-by-design principles, and the role of open, industry-led technical standards in enabling safe, scalable, and interoperable agentic AI across borders.

day20.Title: AI and Open Networks: Creating Impact at Scale
day20.Name: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Biocon Group
day20.name: Mr. James Manyika, Google - Research, Labs, Technology & Society and  UN Advisory Body on AI
day20.name_2: Sangbu Kim, The World Bank Group
day20.Description_1: AI can deliver population-scale impact across healthcare, education, agriculture, and energy only when coordination is built into the system through Open Networks and Digital Public Infrastructure. In India, AI agents leveraging open networks already help citizens access vital services via simple mobile interfaces—demonstrating how this model bridges structural gaps in service delivery. This session examines how this interoperable infrastructure translates AI intent into action, enabling safe, privacy-preserving impact that can scale across borders.

day20.Title: Rightsizing Governance in an AI-Driven World
day20.Name: Isabella Wilkinson, Chatham House
day20.name: Melika Carroll, Cohere
day20.Description_1: This panel explores how India and partner nations can use AI for real-world impact, bridge digital divides, and support inclusive growth. Aligned with the UK–India strategic tech partnership, it shows how global forums can turn shared ambition into action on AI governance and deployment. The discussion covers shared compute and data, support for smaller states, and high-impact collaboration across healthcare, education, and climate for responsible AI at scale.

day20.Title: Scaling Climate Solutions: Data, AI, and India's Energy Transformation
day20.Name: Akhilesh Magal, Climate Dot Foundation
day20.name: Dr. Cormekki Whitley, data.org
day20.name_2: Dr. Priya Donti, MIT EECS and LIDS
day20.Description_1: Open data and AI can significantly strengthen climate resilience and help India meet its net zero target by 2070 and 500 GW renewable capacity by 2030. Achieving this requires faster digital transformation across climate and energy institutions and stronger Climate AI talent to break silos. This session convenes experts to examine the building blocks of a climate-energy data ecosystem, showcasing real-world use cases

day20.Title: Beyond Technicality: Multidisciplinary AI Governance for Real-World Impact
day20.Name: Dame Wendy Hall, Web Science Institute at the University of Southampton
day20.name: James (Kayliang) Ong, Artificial Intelligence International Institute (AIII)
day20.name_1: Jeanna Matthews, Association of Computing Machinery
day20.name_3: John Harvard, Tony Blair Institute for Global Change
day20.Description_1: This interactive roundtable broadens the AI safety conversation by foregrounding societal, institutional, and ethical dimensions beyond purely technical approaches. It treats AI governance as a multidisciplinary, context-aware challenge rooted in real deployment settings and community experience. Through brief interventions and guided discussion, participants will identify shared priorities and co-develop principles and collaboration areas to embed interdisciplinary expertise, civil society voices, and context-sensitive evaluation into national and global AI policy frameworks.
day20.Description_4: Merve Hickok, Center for AI & Digital Policy, AIethicist.org
day20.Description_7: Neha Kumar, School of Interactive Computing at Georgia Tech

day20.Title: Intelligent Telecom Networks in the age of AI and Data Sovereignty
day20.Name: Ambika Khurana, Vodafone Idea Limited
day20.name: Debashish Chakraborty, GSMA Services India Private Limited
day20.name_1: Deepak Maheshwari, Centre for Social and Economic Progress (CSEP)
day20.Description_1: As India enters its next phase of AI-driven digital growth, telecom networks are becoming the intelligent backbone of Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI). This session explores how AI-native networks, edge computing, and interoperable standards can strengthen trust, resilience, and digital sovereignty. The discussion will examine the convergence of telecom, AI, and DPI, and how India can play a leadership role in shaping globally compatible architectures in driving consensus across the mobile ecosystem.

day20.Title: AI Literacy and Building for Children in a Digital Age
day20.Name: ​Atish Joshua Gonsalves, LEGO Education
day20.name: Dr. Saadhna Panday, UNICEF India
day20.Description_1: The pace of AI can feel overwhelming and, rightly, increasing attention is being given to minimizing its negative impacts on children. However, it is not enough for children to simply adapt to AI - they also need foundational competencies to understand, engage with and critically assess the systems of the future. Experts will discuss approaches to AI literacy and explore how to build empowering technology for children.

day20.Title: Multistakeholder Partnerships for Thriving AI Ecosystems
day20.Name: Arundhati Bhattacharya, Salesforce
day20.name: Dr. Bärbel Kofler, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
day20.name_2: Robert Opp, United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
day20.Description_1: This session demonstrates how multi-stakeholder collaboration on Responsible AI builds inclusive ecosystems and advances sustainable development across health, education, climate resilience, and public sector innovation. It showcases scalable partnership models—such as blended finance, compute sharing, open data, and capacity building—reviews progress since the Hamburg Declaration on Responsible AI for the SDGs, and identifies actionable pathways for future collaboration and impact.
day20.Description_3: German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

day20.Title: Responsible AI in Action: How Global Enterprises Are Building Trust at Scale
day20.Name: Mr. Manish Gupta, Google DeepMind
day20.name: Mr. Sundar R Nagalingam, NVIDIA
day20.Description_1: AI is reshaping industries worldwide, and trust plays an important role in enabling sustainable innovation. This session will bring together AI leaders and decision-makers to discuss approaches to responsible AI deployment at scale. The discussion will examine how enterprises are embedding ethics, transparency, and accountability into mission-critical AI systems while balancing speed, compliance, and innovation. Participants will gain insights, strategies, and real-world examples related to building safe and trusted AI systems.

day20.Title: AI and Workforce Transformation: India's Roadmap to Global Competitiveness
day20.Name: Mr Ravi Aurora, Mastercard Inc.
day20.name: Mr Srikrishna Ramakarthikeyan, Hexaware
day20.name_1: Mr Vishnu R Dusad, Nucleus Software
day20.Description_1: This session will explore how AI is reshaping jobs, skills, and productivity, and how India can convert this disruption into a strategic advantage. It will examine the evolving AI skills landscape and discuss how to build inclusive, AI-native talent pipelines through skilling, reskilling, vernacular learning, and stronger industry–academia collaboration. Bringing together policymakers, industry leaders, academia, and SMEs, the session will also highlight role of private industry in positioning India as a globally competitive hub for AI talent.

day20.Title:
Building
Blocks for National AI Strategy and Implementation
day20.Name: Atsushi Yamanka, JICA
day20.name: Dr. Hoda Baraka, Govt. of Egypt and Cairo University
day20.name_2: Laura Gilbert, Tony Blair Institute for Global Change
day20.name_3: Phani Nagarjuna, Telangana AI Innovation Hub
day20.Description_1: This high-impact conference unites global AI leaders—disruptors, VCs, practitioners, and national decision-makers—to exchange real-world strategies for scaling AI responsibly. Sessions feature report launches like "Great Powers in the Age of AI," tackling geopolitical roles, enterprise transformations, and national ecosystem challenges (data/compute/talent gaps). Moderated panels explore governance transitions, India's leadership potential, and pathways for secure, equitable innovation across Industrial-to-Information Age dynamics.

day20.Title: The Role of Science in International AI Governance
day20.Name: Ajay Kumar Sood, GoI
day20.name: Amandeep Gill, UN ODET
day20.name_1: Anil Ananthaswamy, Science journalist and Author
day20.Description_1:
Scientific knowledge is an essential foundation for effective governance of Artificial
Intelligence. As AI systems evolve, there is a growing need for transparent and evidence-
based assessments to guide international standards and ensure inclusive innovation.
This session will explore how the science-policy interface can inform international AI
governance and strengthen cooperation between stakeholders.
day20.Description_3: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
day20.Description_4: Balaraman Ravindran, Wadhwani School of Data Science & AI, IIT Madras

day20.Title: Heterogeneous Compute for Democratizing Access to AI: From Workload Awareness to Scalable Deployment
day20.Name: Bhawna Agarwal, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, India
day20.name: Daisy Chittilapilly, Cisco
day20.Description_1: This practitioner-led session will discuss how to address critical challenge of making AI economically viable and globally accessible by moving beyond the "GPU-only" paradigm to strategic, workload-aware compute architectures. Featuring technology leaders alongside government stakeholders, panel will demonstrate how matching AI workloads to the right hardware mix—CPUs, NPUs, TPUs, and GPUs—can reduce costs while maintaining performance i.e., maximize RoI. The discussion focuses on practical deployment strategies, from edge-cloud orchestration to real-world placement decisions.
day20.Description_4: Prof. Kamakoti V., Padma Shree, IIT Madras
day20.Description_7: Shri D. Sridhar Babu, Telangana Government

day20.Title: Safe and Trusted AI High-Level Event: Responsible Practices and Industry Standards
day20.Name: Alexandria Walden, Google
day20.name: Ankit Bose, Nasscom Responsible AI Office
day20.Description_1: This session convenes diverse stakeholders to exchange perspectives on building trustworthy and socially beneficial AI. It focuses on practical safeguards, shared accountability, capacity building, and alignment around good practices that support innovation while protecting people and communities, encouraging cooperation and actionable pathways for responsible AI adoption.
day20.Description_7: Peggy Hicks, OHCHR Thematic Engagement and Special Procedures

day20.Title: Trustworthy AI for All: Democratizing AI Resources Across the Stack
day20.Name: Carsten Maple, The Alan Turing Institute
day20.name: Dame Professor Wendy Hall, University of Southampton
day20.Description_1: Many countries are developing strategies for sovereign AI capabilities. Not all nations, especially LMICs, can have total control of the supply chain for their own AI stack. Such nations need the ability to have agency and control of their own AI. This panel will discuss the requirements for sovereign AI, the role private and public organisations play in delivering this, and the mechanisms that can be deployed to ensure a trustworthy and responsible AI stack.

day20.Title: Scaling Trusted AI: How France and India Are Building Industrial & Innovation Bridges
day20.Name: Arthur Mensch, Mistral AI
day20.name: Arun Sadheesh, TNP Consultants
day20.Description_1: This flagship Indo-French session brings together government and industry leaders to advance trusted, responsible, and scalable AI. Featuring keynote visions from India and France, moderated dialogues, and a high-level panel, the event focuses on AI infrastructure, industrial deployment, deep tech, and sovereign data systems. It strengthens bilateral policy alignment, catalyses industry partnerships, and accelerates joint R&D, positioning the India AI Summit as a premier global platform for AI cooperation and innovation.

day20.Title: AI for Resilience: Closing the Technology Adoption Gap in Disaster Risk Reduction
NextGen AI: Skills, Safety, and Social Value — technical mastery aligned with ethical standards.
day20.ROom: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3
day20.Name: Prof.(Dr.) Alok Pandey, Dean, O.P. Jindal Global University
day20.name: Prof. Jawar Singh, IIT Patna
day20.name_1: Dr. Sarabjot Singh Anand, Co-Founder, Tartras Data, Head-Sabudh Foundation
day20.name_2: Mr. Muraleedharan Manninqal, CEO, Information & Communication Technology Academy, Kerala
day20.name_3: Mr. Kunal Gupta, MD, Mount Talant Consulting Pvt. Ltd., Delhi
day20.Description_1: Equip participants with practical AI skills and ethical frameworks to build socially beneficial systems. Through hands‑on labs, bias audits, explainability toolkits, and industry mentorship, the program blends technical training with governance and deployment best practices—culminating in portfolio-ready capstones that prioritize safety, fairness, and measurable social impact.
day20.Description_4: Mr. Vikash Srivastava, Chief Growth Strategist, Vinsys IT Services (Pune)

day20.Title: GIZ (Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit) Report & toolkit launch (Hosted by Bhashini)
day20.ROom: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
day20.Description_1:
Policy Report & Developer's Toolkit on "Building an Open 
& Responsible Voice Technology Ecosystem in India: A Policy Framework for Digital Inclusion in India

day20.Title: Scaling AI Infrastructure from KW to GW – Executive Briefing Connect (Hosted by Vertiv)
day20.ROom: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
day20.Description_1: Focuses on the dramatic evolution of AI infrastructure as compute demand scales from kilowatt‑level racks to gigawatt‑scale facilities. It explores how specialized, high‑density AI data centers

day20.Title: Digital Ministers / Senior Officials Panel on the 2026 International AI Safety Report
day20.Name: Adam Beaumont, AI Security Institute, United Kingdom
day20.name: Alondra Nelson, Institute for Advanced Study
day20.name_2: Lee Tiedrich, Inaugural AI Multidisciplinary Initiative Fellow, University of Maryland
day20.name_3: Yoshua Bengio, Université de Montréal; MILA; LawZero
day20.Description_1: AI capabilities outpace the evidence-base on impacts and safeguards, creating a dilemma for policymakers: How to act early enough to reduce risk while ensuring progress of effective approaches? Turing Award-winner Yoshua Bengio and global experts will present and discuss the key findings of the International AI Safety Report, an initiative backed by 30+ countries and organizations like the EU, OECD and UN, providing a science-based understanding of general-purpose AI capabilities, emerging risks, and mitigation measures.

day20.Title: AI Beyond Moonshots: A Playbook for Many
day20.Name: Abhineet Kaul, Access Partnership
day20.name: Brando Benifei, European Parliament
day20.name_2: Dr. Rachel Adams, Global Center on AI Governance
day20.Description_1: As India advances from AI strategy to economy-wide adoption, the challenge is translating digital foundations into measurable AI diffusion across sectors, regions, and populations. This session explores how to convert AI readiness into tangible outcomes—driving productivity, inclusion, and competitiveness while offering a scalable model for the Global South. Leaders will discuss moving from pilots to scaled deployment, leveraging policy instruments, financing mechanisms, and India's digital public infrastructure to unlock AI's transformative potential.

day20.Title: The Agent Universe: From Automation to Autonomy
day20.Name: Harinder Takhar, Paytm Labs
day20.name: Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Paytm
day20.Description_1: This session explores software's shift from passive tools to autonomous, goal-driven agents—where agency replaces interfaces. Key signals include machine-first platforms, "login as agent" paradigms, and intent-driven workflows transforming commerce, governance, and productivity. The session spotlights India's leadership through scale, digital infrastructure, and talent; and encourages audiences to rethink who—or what—powers the future of computing.

day20.Title: Building Public Interest AI: Catalytic Funding for Equitable Access to Compute Resources
day20.Name: Abhishek Singh, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI
day20.name: Andrew Sweet, The Rockefeller Foundation
day20.name_2: Dr. Saurabh Garg, Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, GoI
day20.Description_1: This event will mark the launch of the working report on "Opening Up Computational Resources for New AI Futures" by Secretary, MOSPI in the presence of Additional Secretary, MeitY. The event includes a keynote and a panel discussion that brings together senior govt officials and global AI experts to discuss pathways for democratising AI. How will catalytic funding for public interest and South–South partnerships democratise access and affordability of compute in the Global South?

day20.Title: Regulatory Pathway for AI-Driven Medical Devices: Bridging Training, Validation, and Clinical Evaluation
day20.Name: Aseem Sahu, CDSCO
day20.name: Dr Krithika Rangarajan, AIIMS, New Delhi
day20.name_2: Dr. Aparna Mukherjee, Division of Development Research, ICMR
day20.Description_1: This session is being convened to align the development, validation, and deployment of AI-enabled medical devices with India's evolving regulatory landscape. The session will examine AI-SiMD and AI-SaMD across the full lifecycle, including data quality, algorithm training, change management, technical and clinical validation, human oversight, and patient safety. Leveraging particular ongoing reasearch initiatives and draft guidance, it will foster informed, multi-stakeholder dialogue to support safe, effective, and regulation-compliant AI adoption.
day20.Description_3: Indian Council of Medical Research Headquarters, New Delhi

day20.Title: Empowering People in the Age of AI: German–Asian Partnerships for Talent, Innovation, and the Future of Work
day20.Name: Arthur Rapp, German Centre for Research and Innovation
day20.name: Dr Kusumita Arora, Indo-German Science & Technology Centre (IGSTC)
day20.name_1: Dr. Baerbel Kofler, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
day20.name_2: Mr. Augustus Azariah, Associated Chamber of Commerce (ASSOCHAM)
day20.name_3: Mr. Jan Noether, Indo German Chamber of Commerce
day20.Description_1: This panel explores how German–Asian cooperation bridges AI skill gaps to drive SME productivity and innovation. Experts will discuss strategic partnerships between government, industry, and academia to integrate vocational training with AI-led ecosystems. By showcasing collaboration models like the AI Academia Innovation Partnership, the session offers actionable pathways for preparing a future-ready workforce and securing long-term competitiveness in an AI-driven global economy.
day20.Description_3: German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
day20.Description_4: Prof. Dr. Clas Neumann, Head of Global SAP Labs Network

day20.Title: AI Solutions for Climate Resilience: Scaling Innovation and Efficiency
day20.Name: Adam Sobey, Alan Turing Insitute
day20.name: Ankur Puri, McKinsey
day20.Description_1: This session will outline the potential of AI solutions in addressing  both climate resilience and mitigation. Leaders from academia, industry and international agencies will discuss practical AI frameworks and solutions across resilience challenges as well as mitigation verticals including energy systems, the built environment, sustainable agriculture and horizontals such as supply chains and materials innovation.

day20.Title: MahaAI: Building Safe, Secure and Smart Governance
day20.Name: Davinder Sandhu, Primus Partners
day20.name: Dr. Amit Kapoor, Institute for Competitiveness
day20.name_1: Dr. Anupam Chattopadhyay, Nanyang Technological University
day20.name_3: Mr. Ashish Tewari, Infosys Responsible AI Office (India)
day20.Description_1: This session will showcase Maharashtra's approach to building safe, secure and citizen-centric AI governance. It will examine how the State is embedding ethics, data protection, security and AI system for public services, safety and administration. The discussion will outline Maharashtra's policy roadmap for responsible AI adoption and highlight how AI can drive economic growth and social good while remaining transparent, accountable and trusted.

day20.Title: Breaking Barriers: Multilingual AI as a Bridge to Democratic Access
day20.Name: Ayah Bdeir, Current AI
day20.name: Dr. Amitabh Nag, Bhashini
day20.name_2: Markus Reubi, Federal Department of Foreign Affairs FDFA
day20.name_3: PD Dr. Alex Ilic, ETH AI Center
day20.Description_1: AI's potential remains limited if it serves only dominant languages, deepening digital divides. This panel, featuring ICAIN and experts from Africa, Europe, and Asia, highlights how multilingual AI can democratize access to technology. It showcases Apertus, an open-source multilingual AI model from ETH Zurich/EPFL, and its real-world applications, emphasizing global collaboration to advance public-interest AI and inclusive innovation.
day20.Description_3: Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs FDFA
day20.Description_4: Prof. Dr. Annie Hartley, EPFL / Director LiGHT

day20.Title: AI for the Good of All - Brazilian Perspectives on the Future of AI
day20.Name: Esther Dweck, Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
day20.name: Eugênio Vargas Garcia, Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
day20.name_1: Hugo Valadares, Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
day20.name_2: Luanna Sant'Anna Roncaratti, Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
day20.name_3: Luciana Santos, Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
day20.Description_1: The event will present Brazil's priorities and vision for artificial intelligence, with a focus on development, innovation, inclusion, sustainability, and public trust. The session will bring together high-level representatives from the Brazilian government to share experiences in public policy, digital transformation, and international governance, exploring solutions that generate concrete benefits for society while ensuring transparency, security, and ethical standards. It will provide a broad overview of the opportunities to build AI for the good of all, grounded in Brazil's approach.
day20.Description_3: Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MRE), Embassy of Brazil in New Delhi

day20.Title: Global AI Capacity Development Network
day20.Name: Amandeep Singh Gill, UN ODET
day20.name: Anne Marie Engtoft Meldgaard, Denmark Tech Ambassador
day20.name_1: B. Ravindran, Wadhwani School of Data Science & AI, IIT Madras
day20.name_2: Mr. H.E. Mr. Rein Tammsaar, Permanent Representative of Estonia
day20.Description_1: The session introduces the Global Network of Centres for Exchange and Cooperation on AI Capacity Building, a new collaborative initiative to align global capacity-building efforts, mobilize resources and strengthen countries' ability to participate meaningfully in the AI ecosystem. During the session, high-level panelists will discuss the role of a networked approach to complement and contribute to capacity-building efforts on artificial intelligence in the context of the establishment of the Global Dialogue on Artificial Intelligence Governance.
day20.Description_3: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
day20.Description_4: Seydina Moussa Ndiaye, Université Numérique Cheikh
day20.Description_7: Vilas Dhar, Patrick J. McGovern Foundation

day20.Title: Beyond Proof of Concepts: Using 4D-AI to Build Sovereign, Sustainable and Responsible AI at Production Scale
day20.Name: Omeed Hashim, Kainos
day20.name: Theresa Yurkewich Hoffmann, Kainos
day20.Description_1: A fast paced, practical session for government and industry leaders who need AI that works in production—not just in pilots. Join us to explore the four dimensions of Trusted AI and discover actionable strategies for scaling secure, responsible, and sovereign AI across the globe.

day20.Title: How Non-Profits are using AI-based Innovations to Scale Impact
day20.Name: Erica Arya, Project Tech4Dev
day20.name: Mainak Roy, Simple Education Foundation
day20.Description_1: Join social sector leaders for a grounded look at a six-month AI Cohort Program. Featuring insights from seven NGOs, this session explores the transition from initial ideas to piloted solutions. Speakers will share reflections on strategic objectives, approaches, challenges, and learnings. Gain a practical framework for implementing responsible, use-case-driven AI in the social sector, backed by real-world outcomes and lessons learned during the journey from concept to impact.

day20.Title: Panel Discussion: Reimagining AI and STEM Education for India's Next Generation
day20.Name: Abhijeet Upponi, Submer
day20.name: Ajay Data, Data Group of Industries
day20.name_1: Dr Raj Kumar, O.P. Jindal Global University (JGU)
day20.Description_1: AI is poised to  accelerate India's economic growth, positioning the country to become a trillion-dollar digital economy by 2030,  by preparing the next generation to contribute meaningfully to Viksit Bharat. This session aims to explore best practices and evolving models in AI and STEM education across curriculum design, pedagogy, teacher capacity, and infrastructure with ethical, and inclusive use of AI at its core.
day20.Description_4: Shri Narendra Bhooshan (IAS), Departments of Technical Education, Energy and Additional Energy, Government of Uttar Pradesh

day20.Title: Partnering on American AI Exports
AI-Driven Enforcement: Better Governance through Effective Compliance & Services
day20.Name: Abhishek Kumar, Central Board of Direct Taxes
day20.name: Avneesh Pandey, SEBI
day20.name_1: Harssh A Poddar, Supdt. Of Police, Nagpur Rural
day20.Description_1: AI is transforming enforcement by enabling smarter compliance, better public services, and more responsive governance. This symposium aims to bring together, law enforcement, academia, and industry experts to explore how AI can strengthen institutional capabilities, improve service delivery, and support effective compliance, while promoting responsible adoption within evolving governance frameworks.

day20.Title: Keynote Address
day20.Name: Raj Reddy, Turing Award–Winning AI Pioneer Professor Emeritus, Carnegie Mellon University

day20.Title: Panel: AI in Science
day20.Name: Irakli Beridze, Head, Centre for AI & Robotics, UNICRI
day20.name: Prof. Antoine Petit, CEO and Chairman of CNRS, France
day20.name_1: Joelle Pineau, Chief AI Officer, Cohere
day20.name_3: Moderator: Abhay Karandikar, Secretary, Department of Science and Technology

day20.Title: Fireside Chat
day20.Name: Børge Brende, President & CEO, World Economic Forum
day20.name: Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister for Railways, Information and Broadcasting & Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India

day20.Title: Fireside Chat
day20.Name: Børge Brende, President & CEO, World Economic Forum
day20.name: Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister for Railways, Information and Broadcasting & Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India
day20.name_1: Moderator: Siddharth Zarabi, Editor, Business Today

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Jeetu Patel, President and Chief Product Officer, Cisco Inc

day20.Title: Aligning AI Governance Across the Technology Stack
day20.Name: Aparna Bawa, Zoom Communications
day20.name: David Zapolsky, Amazon
day20.name_1: Jason Oxman, Information Technology Industry Council
day20.Description_1: This high-level CXO panel will explore how AI governance frameworks can be aligned across the entire technology stack—from semiconductors and compute infrastructure to AI models, applications, and deployment. Panelists will discuss risk-based, interoperable approaches that support innovation while clearly defining roles across the AI value chain. The session will highlight practical governance challenges and opportunities for global coordination, with a focus on collaboration between like-minded partners.

day20.Title: AI Competitiveness through Regional Collaboration
day20.Name: Børge Brende, World Economic Forum
day20.Description_1: This roundtable will convene senior leaders at stakeholders level for an informal strategic exchange on strengthening AI competitiveness at regional and global levels. The discussion will focus on widening access to sovereign AI capabilities while preserving national choice and policy autonomy, and using regional and international collaboration to reduce dependencies and increase resilience.

day20.Title: Speaking Everyone's Language: The Key to Inclusive AI Opportunity
day20.Name: Ankur Vora, Gates Foundation
day20.name: Chenai Chair, Masakhane African Languages Hub
day20.name_2: Dr Amandeep Singh Gill, Under-Secretary-General and Special Envoy for Digital and Emerging Technologies
day20.name_3: Dr Bärbel Kofler, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development
day20.Description_1: AI promises to transform lives through lifesaving health advice, early warning systems, and food security—but only if it speaks everyone's language. For billions speaking local languages across Africa and Asia, this remains an urgent and critical barrier to inclusive development. Join Global South ministers, UN leaders, technologists, and major funders as they unveil pioneering solutions, positioning linguistic diversity as the gateway to addressing data sovereignty, compute access, and achieving transformative AI equity at scale.
day20.Description_4: Julie Delahanty, International Development Research Centre

day20.Title: Catalyzing Global Investment for Equitable and Responsible AI in Health
day20.Name: Alain Labrique, WHO Headquarters, Geneva
day20.name: Catharina Boehma, WHO South-East Asia Region-Opening
day20.name_2: Justice Prathiba M. Singh, Delhi High Court
day20.name_3: Ken-Ichiro Natsume, World Intellectual Property Organization – WIPO
day20.Description_1: This strategic roundtable will convene senior policymakers, development partners, and financing institutions to discuss approaches for strengthening and aligning investment in artificial intelligence for health. The session will examine current financing gaps, opportunities for coordinated and sustainable investment, and governance considerations to support responsible, equity-oriented AI adoption. Discussions will focus on enabling country-led priorities, strengthening health system foundations, and ensuring that AI contributes to safe, inclusive, and sustainable public health outcomes.

day20.Title: High-level Panel Discussion on AI Bridges: India–Israel Innovation Dialogue
day20.Name: Erez Naftali Askal, Israel Artificial Intelligence Directorate
day20.name: Mr. Sanjay Kadaveru, Action for India
day20.name_1: Ms. Shira Lev Ami, Israel National Digital Directorate
day20.name_2: Yoel Ben Or, Ministry of Health, Israel
day20.Description_1: This high-level panel at the AI Impact Summit 2026 explores the strategic synergy between India and Israel. The session brings together stakeholders to examine opportunities for collaboration by integrating India's scale and technical talent with Israel's research and innovation ecosystem and governance approaches. The discussion will chart actionable pathways for collaboration across innovation, ethics, and market access, aiming to build a responsible, globally competitive AI ecosystem driven by the complementary strengths of both nations.

day20.Title: AI and Intellectual Property: Building an Equitable Innovation Ecosystem
day20.Name: Dr. Ulrike Till, World Intellectual Property Organization
day20.name: Mr. Ameet Datta, ADP Law Offices
day20.name_2: Mr. Blaise Fernandes, Indian Music Industry
day20.name_3: Mr. Kenichiro Natsume, World Intellectual Property Organization
day20.Description_1: The session will explore India's strategic opportunity to shape global discourse on AI-IP governance, assess policy imperatives relating to AI-driven innovation, frontier model development, AI applications, and small-model innovation as highlighted in the Economic Survey 2026-27, and underscore India's development priorities supported by its strengthening digital ecosystem, an expanding startup base, and ongoing AI-related IP reforms.
day20.Description_4: Mr. Mihir Rale, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas

day20.Title: Leadership Dialogue on AI in Mobility: Accelerating the Future of Intelligent Transport
day20.Name: Dr Shiv Kumar, ITS India Forum
day20.Description_1: Leadership Dialogue on AI in Mobility: Accelerating the Future of Intelligent Transport

day20.Title: Who Watches the Watchers? Exploring Independent Verification in AI Governance
day20.Name: Dean Ball, Foundation for American Innovation; Fathom
day20.name: Gregory C. Allen, CSIS Wadhwani Center, Center for Strategic and International Studies
day20.Description_1: This session explores how independent assurance, operationalised through a marketplace of independent verification organisations, can support greater trust and adoption in artificial intelligence systems. The discussion will bring together AI policymakers and experts to examine mechanisms for realigning developer and deployer incentives with the public interest across different country contexts.

day20.Title: AI governance in the Age of Powerful AI - IInternational Perspectives and the Code of Practice
day20.Name: Henna Virkkunen, European Commission
day20.name: Lucilla Sioli, European Commission
day20.name_1: Sean Ó hÉigeartaigh, University of Cambridge
day20.Description_1: Bringing perspectives from government, academia, industry, and civil society across regions, the session will explore how AI governance frameworks can support responsible innovation, and build shared trust in widely deployed AI systems. This panel will also introduce the Code of Practice for general-purpose AI models and examine its implications globally. The discussion will unpack requirements on transparency, copyright, and lifecycle risk management, including safeguards for advanced models with systemic impact.

day20.Title: Open Networks in the Global South
day20.Name: Mr. Aniket Doegar, Haqdarshak
day20.name: Mr. Sachin Gopalan, Indonesia Economic Forum
day20.Description_1: The session will explore how open digital networks and interoperable public infrastructure, supported by Artificial Intelligence, are transforming digital economies in the Global South. Drawing on experiences such as UPI and ONDC in India and emerging open networks. The discussion will focus on inclusive payments, commerce, and innovation for small merchants and consumers.

day20.Title: AI for Economic Growth and Social Good- Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation- Fireside Chat
day20.Name: Himanshu Joshi, AIM
day20.name: Kavikrut, T-Hub Foundation
day20.Description_1: AI for Economic Growth & Social Good: Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation is a high-level, solutions-oriented panel bringing together government, multilaterals, industry leaders, and innovation ecosystems to translate India's AI ambition into real-world impact. The session spotlights deployable AI use-cases across healthcare, agriculture, skilling, mobility, and financial inclusion, emphasizing responsible AI, blended finance, and cross-sector partnerships to scale beyond pilots toward measurable, population-level outcomes aligned with the IndiaAI Mission
day20.Description_4: Rekha Srinivasan, United Way of Hyderabad

day20.Title: Peace, Power and Perspectives: A Value-Based Approach to Trustworthy AI
day20.Name: Amlan Mohanty, NITI Aayog, GoI
day20.name: Heather Broomfield, Norwegian Government AI Unit, Norwegian Digitalisation Agency
day20.name_2: Karianne Oldernes Tung, Norwegian Ministry of Digitalisation and Public Governance
day20.Description_1: This session aims to examine the strategic role of Sovereign AI in strengthening India's national security and internal security frameworks. It will explore how indigenous AI capabilities enhance defence preparedness, cyber resilience, space and border surveillance, and policing operations, while augmenting human decision-making. The discussion will also address emerging security domains, counter-terror financing, deepfake detection, and the role of public–private collaboration in building secure, self-reliant AI systems aligned with India's 2026 reform vision.
day20.Description_4: Morten Dæhlen, University of Oslo Trusted AI for a Sustainable Global Future
day20.Description_7: Niels Nagelhus Schia, Norwegian Institute of International Affairs, , Norwegian Institute of International Affairs (NUPI) Global Cooperation for Responsible and Trustworthy AI.

day20.Title: Standards as Strategy: Accelerating AI Market Growth
day20.Name: Amanda Craig, Microsoft
day20.name: Balaraman Ravindran, IIT Madras
day20.Description_1: This discussion examines how AI standards simultaneously reduce risk and create business value. As AI capabilities advance, many markets face deployment barriers not from technical limitations but from reliability concerns and broader trust deficits. Robust standards, backed by rigorous evaluation, can unlock market potential. This panel convenes leaders from AI standards and governance organizations alongside industry and policy executives to examine how effective standards enable economic growth, market confidence, and responsible governance.
day20.Description_7: Rohit Israni, Chair AI Standards US (INCITS)

day20.Title: Regional Ministerial Dialogue on AI-Ready Digital Infrastructure
American AI Exports: Adoption & Financing
Keynote
day20.Name: Revanth Reddy, Chief Minister, Telangana

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Marcus Wallenberg, Chairman SEB and Saab

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Cristiano Amon, President and Chief Executive Officer, Qualcomm

day20.Title: Panel
day20.Name: Anna Paula, SVP and Chair Asia Pacific and Asia EMEM, IBM Corporation
day20.name: Rajesh Varrier - President Global Operations, Chairman & Managing Director, Cognizant India
day20.name_1: Sharad Agarwal, CEO Sify Inifinit Spaces Ltd
day20.name_2: Moderator: Arun Sukumar Head, Cyber Security And Internet Governance Initiative, ORF

day20.Title: Panel: Inclusion, Innovation, and the Future of AI
day20.Name: Ivana Bartoletti, Global Chief Privacy & AI Governance Officer, Wipro
day20.name: Dean Ball, Senior Fellow, Foundation For American Innovation
day20.name_1: Gabriela Ramos Patino, Architect of the global ethical standard on AI

day20.Name: Ebba Busch, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Energy & Business, Sweden

day20.Name: John Palfrey, President of the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation
day20.name: Terah Lyons, Managing Director & Global Head of AI & Data Policy, JP Morgan Chase
day20.name_1:
Paula Ingabire, Minister of ICT and Innovation, 
 Government of Rwanda
day20.name_2: Evan Solomon, Minister of AI and Digital Innovation and Minister of Federal Economic Development for Southern Ontario, Canada
day20.name_3: Stephen Byrd, Global Head of Thematic Research, Morgan Stanley
day20.Description_4: Moderator: Rudra Chaudhuri, Vice President, Observer Research Foundation

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Pratyush Kumar and Vivek Raghavan, Sarvam AI

day20.Title: Evaluations and Open Source Software for AI for Social Good at Scale
day20.Name: Mr. Ashwani Sharma, Scientific Progress Team, Foundational Research, Google
day20.name: Mr. Sanket Verma, NumFOCUS
day20.name_2: Ms. Tarunima Prabakhar, Tattle Civic Technologies
day20.Description_1: Aligned with the People, Planet, and Progress Sutras, this session explores how evaluations and open source software can help AI for social good scale responsibly. It will examine how red teaming surfaces factuality issues, language gaps, bias, and hallucinations in high-stakes domains including education, food security, and public health. Using the Summit's framing on inclusion, trust, and access, we will gather user needs to guide our open source red teaming app release.

day20.Title: Responsible AI: From Principles to Practice in Corporate India
day20.Name: Amol Deshpande, RPG Group
day20.name: Andy Parsons, Adobe
day20.name_3: Shantheri Mallaya, Economic Times CIO & CISO.
day20.Description_1: The panel will explore how organisations can move beyond high-level frameworks and embed Responsible AI into enterprise strategy, governance models, operating practices, and decision-making. Panellists will share leadership perspectives on what it takes to implement Responsible AI at scale — from policy benchmarks, boardroom ownership to organisational readiness, operating models and culture.  The objective would be to enable a more uniform and actionable approach to Responsible AI adoption across Corporate India.
day20.Description_4: Vishal Kanvaty, National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI)

day20.Title: AI and the New Frontier for Economic Progress: Linking Innovation to Inclusive Growth
day20.Name: Anu Bradford, Columbia Law School
day20.name: Iqbal Singh Dhaliwal, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
day20.Description_1: This panel discussion will highlight the potential of AI-led economic transformation to enable sustained growth, particularly in the Global South.  Panelists will also highlight risks of economic divides, labor displacement and other adverse social impact. The session will help identify the roles of governments, private enterprises and development institutions working together to align technological innovation with inclusive economic transformation.

day20.Title: Collective AI for Indian Society
day20.Name: Antaraa Vasudev, Civis
day20.name: Dr. Nirav Ajmeri, University of Bristol
day20.Description_1: Can Collective AI close the AI Divide? Collective AI is designed to support whole populations rather than one user at a time. This panel brings together industrial and academic AI leaders to explain and explore Collective AI's huge potential for societal impact across areas like healthcare, democracy, etc. It will address the technical and sociotechnical challenges that must be overcome if Collective AI is to deliver on its huge promise.
day20.Description_4: Prof. Seth Bullock, University of Bristol

day20.Title: Edge AI in Action: Accelerating Development across the Global South
day20.Name: Alagan Mahalingam, Rootcode
day20.name: Dr. Ranjitha Prasad, IIT Delhi
day20.name_3: H.E Amb Lavina Ramkissoon, African Union
day20.Description_1: As AI evolves, the shift from centralized cloud computing to edge AI is transforming how data is processed and acted upon. By moving intelligence closer to data sources such as sensors, mobile devices, and IoT systems, edge AI reduces latency, bandwidth usage, and energy consumption while improving real-time decision-making, privacy, and security. Real-world applications will be highlighted along with emerging lightweight and generative AI models designed for resource-constrained edge environments.

day20.Title: Preparing the Future: AI-Driven Strategies for Workforce and Economic Growth
day20.Name: Mr Chandrajit Banerjee, Confederation of Indian Industry
day20.name: Mr Puneet Chandok, Confederation of Indian Industry
day20.name_1: Mr Rajeev Memani, Confederation of Indian Industry
day20.name_2: Ms Ipsita Dasgupta, CII and  HP
day20.Description_1: AI can accelerate economic growth by improving efficiency and enabling new forms of innovation. Preparing for the future means treating AI not just as an automation tool, but as a strategic partner for productivity and growth. By 2030, AI adoption across sectors such as manufacturing, healthcare and finance is expected to add trillions to the global economy. As organizations integrate AI, careers increasingly combine machine speed and accuracy with human judgment, empathy, and contextual understanding.

day20.Title: AI Diffusion: From Innovation to Population Scale Impact
day20.Name: Beatriz Vasconcellos, UCL IIPP / Government of Brazil
day20.name: Courtney O'Donnell, Anthropic
day20.name_1: Janet Zhou, Data and Technology Adoption, Gates Foundation
day20.name_2: Keyzom N. Massally, UNDP & G7 AI Hub for Sustainable Development
day20.Description_1: AI impact depends not on pilots, but on sustained adoption across institutions. While innovation is abundant, diffusion capacity remains limited, leaving organizations to repeat costly experiments. This session introduces AI Diffusion Infrastructure as a shared foundation of standards, playbooks, and trusted pathways that reduce operational and compliance risks. Leaders from technology, government, and development will explore how to scale safe, repeatable AI systems across sectors and geographies, turning isolated successes into equitable population scale outcomes.

day20.Title: Enabling Global Enterprise AI Adoption for Impact
day20.Name: Danielle Johnson-Kutch, Docusign
day20.name: Dr. Clas Neumann, SAP
day20.Description_1: A practical, impact-focused discussion on how enterprise AI can deliver measurable gains in productivity, service quality, and inclusive growth. Through real-world global use cases, participants will gain insights into scaling AI adoption across diverse markets, with a focus on workforce skilling, infrastructure, and data readiness. The session will surface actionable lessons, partnership models, and implementation requirements to move from pilot projects to sustainable, replicable AI solutions, particularly in emerging market contexts.

day20.Title: AI and Children's Safety and Wellbeing
day20.Name: Amandeep Singh Gill, UN ODET
day20.name: Chris Lehane, OpenAI
day20.name_2: Maria Bielikova, Kempelen Institute for Intelligent Technologies
day20.Description_1: Children are becoming among the earliest and most intensive users of AI, often before safeguards and regulations are fully in place. This session asks a direct question: how can AI be shaped to strengthen children's safety and wellbeing rather than undermine them? Drawing on technology leaders, child-rights experts, and a young AI innovator, the discussion examines advancing innovation, where risks demand firm limits, and how trust in AI can be built for the next generation.
day20.Description_3: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
day20.Description_7: Raul John Aju, (AIRealm Technologies Pvt Ltd) AI Kid of INDIA

day20.Title: Realizing the Health Value of AI - Safely
day20.Name: Dr. Monika Sharma, Novo Nordisk Foundation
day20.name: Dr. Richard Rukwata, Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe
day20.name_2: Minister Paula Ingabire, Government of Rwanda
day20.Description_1: AI is transforming health in unprecedented ways, but progress only matters when it is safe, trusted, and built for people. At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, we are convening a focused conversation on how AI can responsibly deliver real health value. From global health systems to frontline impact, this session brings together leaders at the intersection of science, data, and care to turn AI's promise into measurable health outcomes.

day20.Title: Ethical AI in Telecom Hardware and Software | Building Customer Trust through AI-Driven Operations
day20.Name: Dr. Durga Malladi, Qualcomm
day20.name: Dr. M P Tangirala, TRAI
day20.Description_1:
This session unites OEMs to discuss embedding responsibility into AI for network infrastructure. Experts explore design principles for 5G/6G chips, base stations, and edge devices, emphasizing transparency and bias-free algorithms amid operations serving billions.
Telecom service providers lead this discussion on governance in AI automation. Panelists address accountability for decisions impacting millions, human oversight in network management, and strategies to sustain public confidence in critical services.

day20.Title: U.S. AI Standards
AI for Viksit Bharat: The Capacity Building Imperative
day20.Name: Anirudh Srivastava, Google
day20.name: Guilherme Alberto Almeida de Almeida, Ministry of Management & Innovation in Public Services, Government of Brazil
day20.Description_1: Mission Karmayogi is advancing the vision of a citizen-centric and future-ready civil service through a democratized, competency-led approach to capacity building.  The event will explore how India is leveraging  artificial intelligence to further strengthen public sector capacity building, highlighting emerging best practices and innovative use cases. It will also deliberate on the creation of a scalable, AI-enabled Digital Public Good, not only for India, but for the world.

day20.Title: AI as Critical Infrastructure for Continuity in Public Services
Keynote
day20.Name: Anne Bouverot, Special Envoy for Artificial Intelligence, France

day20.Title: Panel: AI & Cybersecurity
day20.Name: Ms. Daisy Chittilapilly, President Cisco India & South Asia
day20.name: Catherine Briat, Head of Public and Govt Affairs, Eviden
day20.name_1: Dharshan Shanthamurthy, Chief Executive Officer, SISA
day20.name_2: Pradeep Sekar, Managing Director, Optiv Security Inc.
day20.name_3: Richard Marko, Chief Executive Officer, ESET
day20.Description_4: A. S. Lakshminarayanan (Lakshmi), Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer, Tata Communications

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Uday Shankar, Vice Chairman, JioStar India Private Limited

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Hemant Taneja, Chief Executive Officer, General Catalyst

day20.Title: Panel: AI and the Creative Economy
day20.Name: Nicolas Granatino, Executive Chairman, Tara Gaming
day20.name: Kenichiro Natsume, Assistant Director General, WIPO
day20.name_1: Anna Tumadóttir, Chief Executive Officer, Creative Commons
day20.name_2: Moderator: Ameet Datta, Founder and Managing Counsel, ADP Law Offices

day20.Title: Panel: AI First Education
day20.Name: Olayinka David-West, Dean and Professor of Information Systems, Lagos Business School
day20.name: Theo Farrell, President and Deputy Vice-Chancellor, La Trobe University
day20.name_1: Moderator: Jagdish Babu, Chief Operating Officer, EkStep Foundation

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Vinod Khosla, Founder, Khosla Ventures

day20.Title: STPI Startup ecosystem/Felicitation and MoU Exchange
day20.ROom: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
day20.Description_1:
To recognize and encourage exemplary technology startups nurtured within the STPI ecosystem, Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) will felicitate select startups during the AI Impact Summit.

The felicitation for FY 2024-25 aims to acknowledge startups driving innovation through artificial intelligence led and advanced digital technologies, delivering scalable solutions and measurable business outcomes including revenue growth, alongside employment generation. It will also serve as a national platform to highlight India’s emerging startup success stories, including those from Tier-II and Tier-III regions, and their contribution to the country’s innovation-driven digital economy and the evolving IT and ITeS landscape.

day20.Title: Leveraging Language AI for Citizen-Centric Policing in India: A Model for the World (Hosted by Bhashini)
day20.ROom: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
day20.Name: Sh. Amitabh Nag, CEO Digital India Bhashini Division,
day20.name: Sh. Alok Jain, IPS, Director General, NCRB & National Police Academy
day20.Description_1: "Leveraging Language AI for Citizen‑Centric Policing in India: A Model for the World" highlights how AI—especially multilingual and conversational technologies—can transform policing by making services more accessible, responsive, and inclusive. It focuses on practical AI applications like language‑enabled reporting tools and automated assistance that help citizens communicate with law enforcement in their own languages.

day20.Title: Panel Discussion
day20.Name: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director, International Monetary Fund
day20.name: Doreen Bogdan-Martin, Secretary General, International Telecommunication Union
day20.name_1: Johanna Hill, Deputy Director General, World Trade Organization

day20.Title: Fireside Chat
day20.Name: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director, International Monetary Fund
day20.name: Doreen Bogdan-Martin, Secretary General, International Telecommunication Union
day20.name_1: Johanna Hill, Deputy Director General, World Trade Organization
day20.name_2: Josephine Teo, Minister of Digital Development and Information, Singapore
day20.name_3: Moderator: Mariano-Florentino Cuellar, President, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace

day20.Title: Payments to Commerce: From the lens of People, Planet, and Progress
day20.Name: Caroline Louveaux, Mastercard
day20.name: Combiz Richard Abdolrahimi, Service Now
day20.name_2: Prof. Aparna Gupta, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
day20.Description_1: Digital payments transformed economies by making transactions faster, safer, and more inclusive—with AI at their core. This panel brings together industry and academic leaders who helped shape that journey and now turn their lens from payments to commerce. As commerce enters its next evolution, the discussion explores implications for people, planet, and progress—from trust and inclusion to global trade and sustainability—and how enterprises, governments, and academia can prepare for an AI-native future.

day20.Title: AI as a Topic and a Tool: The Future of Foreign Policy in an Age of Algorithms
day20.Name: Gunda Ehmke, Data Innovation Lab
day20.name: Hans-Christian Mangelsdorf, German Federal Foreign Office
day20.name_1: Norman Schulz, German Federal Foreign Office
day20.Description_1: AI is not just a technological frontier - it is a geopolitical one. The rapid development and deployment of artificial intelligence are reshaping global power dynamics, fueling competition among nations for economic advantage, technological supremacy, and strategic influence. The integration of artificial intelligence into diplomacy and foreign policy is fundamentally transforming how nations engage, negotiate, and collaborate on the global stage.

day20.Title: India at the Centre of the Global AI and Semiconductor Power Shift
day20.Name: Dr Vivek Kumar Singh, NITI Aayog, GoI
day20.name: Dr. Thomas Zacharia, AMD
day20.name_1: Jaya Jagadish, Silicon Design Engineering, AMD
day20.Description_1: The session will have discussion around the convergence of artificial intelligence, semiconductors, and geopolitics, and its implications for global competitiveness, supply chain resilience, and technological trust. As AI becomes a strategic national asset, the session will explore how policy leadership, technological cooperation, and private-sector innovation must align to build secure, resilient, and inclusive AI ecosystems, while highlighting India's emerging role in the global AI and semiconductor value chain.

day20.Title: Supercharging AI Adoption in the Global South: Opportunities and Lessons from the Financial Sector
day20.Name: Ashutosh Sharma, Prosus Ventures
day20.name: Harshil Mathur, Razorpay
day20.Description_1: As one of the most regulated sectors, financial services has emerged as a leader in responsible AI governance, prioritizing aspects such as security and data privacy for trusted deployment. This panel will highlight learnings from the sector's AI journey that can accelerate AI adoption in the Global South. It will distill key lessons from AI governance in finance to drive grassroots AI adoption among small business owners, farmers, public school educators, & local government officials.

day20.Title: Building Population-Scale Digital Public Infrastructure for AI
day20.Name: Dario Amodei, Anthropic
day20.name: Doreen Bogdan-Martin, ITU
day20.Description_1: This session brings together examples of AI solutions that have scaled from pilots to population-level systems, yielding measurable gains in service delivery, productivity, and inclusion. It will surface the governance, infrastructure, and partnership models that enable sustainable scale.

day20.Title: Smaller Footprint, Bigger Impact: Advancing Resilient and Efficient AI Models for a Sustainable Future
day20.Name: Dr Tawfik Jelassi, UNESCO
day20.name: Mr. Arthur Mensch, Republic of Kenya
day20.name_1: Ms Anne BOUVEROT, Government of France
day20.name_2: Ms Anne LE HENANF, Government of France
day20.Description_1: Generative AI now serves a large number of users daily but comes with significant energy costs, which may contribute to unequal access. Training and inference at scale consume substantial electricity, and research suggests that more efficient model design can reduce energy use significantly. This event highlights resilient, resource-efficient AI leveraging lightweight models, compression, and optimization to reduce energy demand, broaden access, address emerging energy bottlenecks, and support sustainable AI deployment worldwide.

day20.Title: Scaling AI Solutions Through South–South Collaboration
day20.Name: Mr. Ankur Vora, Gates Foundation
day20.name: Mr. Lacina Koné, Smart Africa
day20.Description_1:
Big challenges. Shared realities. Stronger solutions.
Across health, agriculture, and education, the Global South is already building AI that works in real conditions and at real scale. This fireside conversation examines what happens when Global South leaders collaborate, and how partnerships can turn AI potential into tangible development outcomes. Join the conversation on building AI solutions together at the India AI Impact Summit 2026.

day20.Title: Connectivity and Inclusive AI for Global Growth
day20.Name: Durga Malladi, EVP, GM, Technology Planning, Edge Solutions and Data Center
day20.Description_1: This session explores inclusive, edge-driven AI and next-generation connectivity, highlighting how on-device, hybrid, and agentic AI can enable global growth, human-centric experiences, and a scalable AI ecosystem.

day20.Title: AI Agents for a Better Tomorrow: Government Services, Climate Action, and Resilient Infrastructure
day20.Name: Lee Tiedrich, Pratt School of Engineering, Duke University
day20.name: Mike Haley, Autodesk
day20.name_1: Sridhar Babu, Information Technology, Electronics & Communications, Industries & Commerce and Legislative Affairs, Telangana
day20.Description_1: This panel will bring together industry and government stakeholders to explore the shift towards autonomous AI agents. The discussion will focus on the engineering architectures required to scale these systems for climate resilience and public services, alongside governance frameworks that support trust and accountability. Moving from theory to practice, the session will examine pathways for public–private collaboration to support secure and responsible AI deployment with tangible outcomes.

day20.Title: AI for Inclusive Societal Development
day20.Name: Aditya Natraj, Piramal Foundation
day20.name: Ms Arundhati Bhattacharya, Salesforce India and South Asia
day20.Description_1: Advancing AI systems that are inclusive by design, empowering diverse communities and ensuring equitable representation

day20.Title: Trusted AI at Scale: A Global South Leadership Dialogue
day20.Name: Deepali Khanna, The Rockefeller Foundation
day20.name: Deepali Khanna, The Rockefeller Foundation
day20.name_1: Eugenio V. Garcia, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brazil
day20.Description_1: This roundtable brings together senior ICT leaders from the global south to turn the Summit's "Safe & Trusted AI" Chakra into practical action. Focusing on embedding institutional safety into fast‑moving AI deployment, it bridges Global North–South governance gaps by translating policy into implementation. The dialogue blends private‑sector risk expertise with public‑sector scale, positioning New Delhi as a hub for inclusive, interoperable AI strategies

day20.Title: AI for Economic Growth & Social Good: Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation
day20.Name: Archana, Sunlit Path Consulting
day20.name: Dr. Angela Lusigi, UNDP India
day20.name_1: Rekha Srinivasan, United Way of Hyderabad
day20.Description_1: It is a high-level, solutions-oriented panel bringing together government, multilaterals, industry leaders, and innovation ecosystems to translate India's AI ambition into real-world impact. The session spotlights deployable AI use-cases across healthcare, agriculture, skilling, mobility, and financial inclusion, emphasizing responsible AI, blended finance, and cross-sector partnerships to scale beyond pilots toward measurable, population-level outcomes aligned with the IndiaAI Mission

day20.Title: Building Trustworthy AI: Foundations and Practical Pathways
day20.Name: Chanda Grover, Ashoka University
day20.name: Dr. Aalok Thakkar, Ashoka University
day20.Description_1: Building Trustworthy AI is an impact-focused workshop examining how responsible and transparent AI systems can enable inclusive, ethical, and sustainable innovation in India. The session includes an interactive exploration of data consent and privacy in real-world AI deployments, the launch of the research paper ASTRA: AI Safety, Trust, & Risk Assessment, and a multi-stakeholder roundtable discussing practical pathways to advance trustworthy AI across policy, industry, and society.

day20.Title: AI for Inclusive and Resilient Agricultural Food Systems
day20.Name: Dr. Arun Pratihast, Wageningen University & Research
day20.name: Dr. Dejan Jakovljevic, FAO
day20.name_1: H.E. Harry Verweij, Kingdom of the Netherlands
day20.name_3: Mr. Nezar Patria, Communications and Digital Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia
day20.Description_1: This session by the Ministry of the Netherlands will explore how artificial intelligence can enable more sustainable, resilient, and responsible agricultural supply chains. It will examine AI use in farm-level efficiency, risk management, sustainability reporting, and trusted data sharing. The discussion will emphasize inclusive approaches that support small farmers and SMEs in lower-income countries to meet sustainability requirements, protect data, and access global agricultural markets.
day20.Description_4: Ms. Audrey Plonk, Science Technology and Innovation (STI)
day20.Description_7: Ms. Debjani Ghosh, NITI Frontier Hub

day20.Title: Capacity Building in Digital Health
day20.Name: Col. (Dr.) Sarvjeet Kaur, Indian Nursing Council
day20.name: Dr. Rajeev Singh Raghuvanshi, CDSCO, Govt. of India
day20.name_1: Dr. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Academy of Digital Health Sciences
day20.name_3: Mr. Aneesh Chopra, Government of the United States, under President Barack Obama
day20.Description_1: Artificial Intelligence has rapidly achieved technical maturity across its first two developmental levels, yet organizational maturity has not kept pace. This panel examines the critical gap between AI capability and institutional readiness. It will explore how targeted capacity building, across leadership, workforce, governance, and processes, can unlock AI's full value. The discussion focuses on activating impact from the bottom of the value chain, ensuring AI adoption translates into measurable outcomes rather than isolated technological success.
day20.Description_4: Mr. Zaw Ali Khan, Criterion Tech
day20.Description_7: Shri D. Sridhar Babu, Government of Telangana

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Prashant Warier, CEO, Qure AI

day20.Title: Panel - From Pilots to Population: Scaling AI for Inclusive Impact
day20.Name: Dario Amodei
day20.name: Doreen Bogdan-Martin

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Naveen Tewari, Founder and CEO, inMobi

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Thomas Scheider, Ambassador, Vice-Director and Co-Director of International Relations (OFCOM), Switzerland

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Vivek Mahajan, CTO, Fujitsu

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Chairperson, Biocon Group

day20.Title: Panel Discussion
day20.Name: Sanjeev Bikhchandani, Founder & Executive Vice Chairman, Info Edge (India)
day20.name: Ravi Venkatesan, Founder, Global Alliance for Mass Entrepreneurship
day20.name_1: Deepak Bagla, Mission Director, Atal Innovation Mission
day20.name_2: Radhicka Kapoor, Senior Employment Specialist, Decent Work Team for South Asia, International Labour Organization
