day20.Name: Lakshmi Pratury, Founder and CEO, INK Global Foundation
day20.name: Kirthiga Reddy, CEO, OptimizeGEO and Founder, AI Kiran
day20.name_2: Archana Vemulapalli, Corporate Vice President, AMD

day20.Title: Fireside Chat
day20.Name: Srinivasan Iyengar, Senior Vice President - General Manager, Central Engineering Group,Intel
day20.name: Sagar Sharma, Head, Business Intelligence and Strategic Affairs, Tata Electronics
day20.name_1: Dr. Vivek Khaneja, Executive Director, CDAC
day20.name_2: Moderator: Aman Khanna, Vice President, Asia Group

day20.Title: Panel Discussion
day20.Name: Sanjeev Bikhchandani, Founder & Executive Vice Chairman, Info Edge (India)
day20.name: Deepak Bagla, Mission Director, Atal Innovation Mission
day20.name_1: Radhicka Kapoor, Senior Employment Specialist, Decent Work Team for South Asia, International Labour Organization

day20.Title: Democratizing AI Resources Bridging the Global Infrastructure Divide - Leadership Talk
day20.Name: Dr. Angela Lusigi, UNDP India
day20.name: Himanshu Nivsarkar, Kotak Mahindra Bank
day20.Description_1:
A high-level, solutions-focused dialogue connecting multilaterals, industry and 
innovation ecosystems to deploy responsible AI at scale for inclusive growth and 
measurable public benefit.

day20.Title: From Research to Industry: Building Foundational Large Language Models for High-Stakes Uses in the Real World
day20.Name: Eun Jae (Jessie) Baek, Thomson Reuters
day20.name: Jonathan Richard Schwarz, Thomson Reuters
day20.Description_1: This session will examine how robust and trustworthy artificial intelligence can be built for high-stakes professional use cases that support economic growth and social good. It will explore how domain-specific research, rigorous evaluation, and collaboration between industry and academia enable safe and scalable AI. The discussion will focus on moving from pilots to real-world deployment through strong governance, reliability, and inclusive design across sectors.

day20.Title: Stakeholder Workshop (World Economic Forum): Advancing Safe, Secure and Trustworthy AI Governance
day20.Name: Agustina Callegari, World Economic Forum
day20.name: Cathy Li, World Economic Forum
day20.Description_1: This semi-private stakeholder dialogue will convene senior public- and private-sector leaders for a focused discussion on advancing practical AI governance. Building on the principles of the Hiroshima AI Process and other global frameworks, the session will explore how shared commitments to safe, secure, and trustworthy AI can be translated into actionable, regionally relevant governance approaches that enable innovation and protect societal interests, as well as strategies for building resilient AI innovation ecosystems through regional collaboration.

day20.Title: Small AI for Big Impact
day20.Name: Aisha Walcott-Bryant, Google Research Africa
day20.name: Alpan Raval, Wadhwani AI
day20.name_2: Illango Patchamuthu, Strategy and Operations (Digital & AI), World Bank Group
day20.name_3: Wassim Hamidouche, Microsoft AI for Good Lab
day20.Description_1: Small AI is essential for scaling solutions in the Global South via data-efficient computing, low-resource datasets, and localized edge inference. Grounded in responsible, local contexts, this session provides a roadmap for ML practitioners in India and beyond to achieve scale. Through a technical lens, we examine how affordable, scalable AI deployment can advance UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), offering global leadership and technical insights into driving meaningful social impact through localized, accessible technology.

day20.Title: Exploring a Regulatory Framework for Open Data
day20.Name: Arun Prabhu, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas
day20.name: Cyril Shroff, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas
day20.name_2: Dr. Sasmit Patra, Rajya Sabha, India
day20.name_3: Prof.  (Dr.) C. Raj Kumar, O.P. Jindal Global University
day20.Description_1: Open data is becoming a core pillar of the global AI ecosystem, enabling innovation, evidence-based policymaking, and improved public service delivery. While high-quality datasets are essential for advanced AI, their governance poses complex challenges. This panel examines the opportunities and challenges presented by executive and sector-specific measures, and statutory frameworks for open data. Bringing together policymakers, legal experts, and industry the discussion will explore balancing openness with safeguards, and innovation with accountability.

day20.Title: The AI-Cyber Nexus: A Strategic Dialogue on Global Security, Trust, and Governance
day20.Name: Alejandro Mayoral Banos, Access Now
day20.name: Brando Benifie, European Parliament
day20.name_1: Maria Paz Canales, Global Partners Digital
day20.name_3: Raman Jit Singh Chima, Access Now
day20.Description_1: This session, will apply the triad of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) to the complex challenges posed by large language models (LLMs) and Agentic AI. It will present learnings from technology developers, civil society, policymakers, and diplomats that can provide an informed, fact-based approach to how cybersecurity policy and AI governance are interconnected.
day20.Description_4: Sara Rendtorff-Smith, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

day20.Title: Designing Health AI for Bharat - A Billion Clinical Realities
day20.Name: Karthik Adapa, WHO
day20.name: Kiran Gopal Vaska, NHA
day20.name_1: Ms. Aswathy S., IAS, Department of Health & Family Welfare
day20.name_2: Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health
day20.name_3: Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health
day20.Description_1: As AI is integrated more closely into indian health care, this discussion brings together pioneers across technology, public systems, and deep last-mile knowledge, public systems and last mile delivery. The session will study ground realities in the Health-AI space. Drawing on institutional memory and frontier innovation, the session explores how Artificial Intelligence must evolve with people, infrastructure and ecosystems to deliver resilient and inclusive health outcomes at population scale.

day20.Title: Sovereign AI for India: Designing the Nation's Future Compute, Data and Innovation Ecosystem
day20.Name: Ankit Bose, Nasscom AI
day20.name: Bhaskar Gorti, Tata Communications
day20.Description_1: This panel will explore how India can build sovereign AI capabilities across compute, data, models, and governance to reduce dependence on foreign systems while aligning AI development with national priorities and constitutional values. The discussion will examine the democratization of AI resources, trusted governance frameworks, affordable national compute infrastructure, India-centric datasets, responsible AI practices, and ways to strengthen India's voice in global AI standards and negotiations.

day20.Title: Making AI for everyone: The case for personal, local, multilingual AI
day20.Name: Andrew Tergis, Current AI
day20.name: Anne Bouverot, Government of France
day20.Description_1: This session will look at a collaborative build, i.e. a local AI device platform that empowers communities to create their own AI tools, in their own language, for their own needs, with complete privacy and control; and a video projection of the build in use. It will also include a fireside chat between AI leaders, and a high-level dialogue between senior delegation of French and Indian officials. Jointly these interventions will explore a multilingual, public-interest AI ecosystem.

day20.Title: Panel Discussion on Reimagining Responsible AI: Frameworks, Safeguards, and Standards for the Next Wave of AI Innovation
day20.Name: Mr. Ashish Tewari, Infosys
day20.name: Mr. Kamesh Shekar, The Dialogue
day20.Description_1: This panel will examine the next phase of Responsible AI frameworks, safeguards, and standards in the context of evolving AI technologies. It will feature a focused discussion to gather practical inputs on strengthening governance mechanisms, lifecycle oversight, risk assessment tools, and global standard setting, with emphasis on responsible innovation in emerging systems such as agentic AI.
day20.Description_3: Coalition for Responsible Evolution of AI (CoRE-AI)

day20.Title: International AI Safety Coordination: What Policymakers Need to Know
day20.Name: Dr. Eileen Donahoe, Sympatico Ventures
day20.name: H. E. Govind Singh Deo, Government of Malaysia
day20.name_3: Mr. Cyrus Hodes, AI Safety Connect
day20.Description_1: The race to AGI/ASI is getting more geopolitical and difficult to control and govern with profound consequences for our societies and civilisations. This session will aim to delineate an actionable governance agenda to address that situation, exploring advanced AI technical and governance needs .
day20.Description_4: Mr. Jann Tallinn, Future of Life Institute
day20.Description_7: Mr. Nicolas Miailhe, AI Safety Connect

day20.Title: Applying AI: How AI Innovators and Governments Reshape the Public Sector
day20.Name: Arthur Mensch, Mistral
day20.name: Henna Virkkunen, European Commission
day20.Description_1: This panel brings together global leaders and innovators to examine the transformative potential of AI within the public sector. The discussion will delve into the roles of AI developers and governmental bodies, focusing on how their collaboration can translate trustworthy AI principles into tangible public services and policy-making results. The event will spotlight actionable strategies, visionary ideas and ways to deploy AI systems that can deliver social and economic value.

day20.Title: Humanity in the Loop- Balancing Innovation and Ethics in the Age of AI
day20.Name: Debjani Ghosh, NITI Aayog, GoI
day20.name: Dr Mariagrazia Squicciarini, UNESCO
day20.name_2: Justice Gilmar Mendes, Brazil's Supreme Federal Court
day20.Description_1: "Humanity in the Loop" will explore how human rights, transparency, and ethics can drive responsible AI innovation. Bringing together leaders from governments, industry, academia, civil society, and multilateral bodies, the session will showcase practical approaches to embedding values-based governance in AI ecosystems. Discussions will center on trust-building, inclusion, and leadership in ethical innovation to ensure that AI advances serve humanity equitably and sustainably.

day20.Title:
MedTech and AI Innovations
in Public Health Systems
day20.Name: Dr. Rakesh Kalapala, Centre for Obesity and Metabolic Therapy AIG Hospitals, Hyderabad
day20.name: Mr. Sanjay Seth, Head of Public Health / Tobacco Control
day20.name_1: Mr. Shiv Kumar, Swasti – Health Catalyst
day20.name_2: Mr. Suhel Bidani, Gates Foundation (India Office)
day20.name_3: Ms. Saraswathi Padmanabhan, Tata Medical & Diagnostics (Tata MD)
day20.Description_1: This session showcases practical deployment experiences, highlighting how AI is transforming disease surveillance, diagnostics, and last-mile delivery in resource-limited settings. Through high-level keynotes, real-world case studies, and a panel discussion on "From Innovation to Institutionalisation," the session explores scalable implementation models, regulatory frameworks, and ethical data governance. By convening policymakers, industry innovators, and administrators, the session defines an actionable roadmap for scaling AI-driven solutions within government infrastructure, fostering high-impact partnerships to strengthen public-health delivery.
day20.Description_4: Shri Saurabh Gaur, Health Medical & Family Welfare, Government of Andhra Pradesh
day20.Description_7: Shri Saurabh Jain, Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, GoI

day20.Title: Harnessing AI to Manage Climate Extremes and Build Sustainable Systems
day20.Name: Dev Niyogi, University of Texas at Austin, Jackson School of Geosciences
day20.name: Dr. Akshara Kaginalkar, Atria University, Bangalore
day20.name_2: Dr. M. Ravichandran, Ministry of Earth Sciences
day20.Description_1: The panel discussion will convene leading researchers, technocrats, investors, and policymakers to explore "AI for Sustainability and Sustainable AI." It will examine how AI can accelerate India's transition toward climate resilience and sustainable growth, particularly in managing compounding extreme events at hyper-local scales and services for impacted sectors operations. Aligned with the summit's Planet focus, the panel will discuss science driven innovation, trusted systems, and pathways to translate ideas from lab to product ecosystems.
day20.Description_7: Er. Manish Bhardwaj, National Disaster Mitigation Authority (NDMA)

day20.Title: Fireside Chat: From Cloud to Edge - Scaling AI Across Compute Layers
Keynote
day20.Name: Giordano Albertazzi, Chief Executive Officer, Vertiv

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Sangita Reddy, Joint Managing Director, Apollo Hospitals

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Matthew Prince, Chief Executive Officer, Cloudflare

day20.Title: Panel: AI in Healthcare
day20.Name: John Halamka Mayo Clinic Platform
day20.name: R S Sharma, Former Chief Executive Officer, NHA

day20.name_2: Chris Ciauri, Managing Director for International, Anthropic
day20.name_3: Moderator: Rizwan Koita, Chairperson of the Board, National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare, India

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Vijay Shekar Sharma, CeO, Paytm

day20.Title: Panel Discussion
day20.Name: Salil Parekh, CEO, Infosys
day20.name: K. Krithivasan, CEO, Tata Consultancy Services
day20.name_1: C Vijayakumar, CEO & MD, HCL Technologies
day20.name_2: Arundhati Bhattacharya, Chairperson & CEO, Salesforce India
day20.name_3: Anand Deshpande, Founder, Chairman, & MD, Persistent Systems

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Takahito Tokita, President and CEO Fujitsu

day20.Title: Founders' Adda
day20.Name: Archana Jahagirdar, Rukam Capital
day20.name: Pradyum Gupta, Papli Labs
day20.Description_1: The Adda is a forum for AI founders to move past polished narratives and into candid, practical exchange. It is designed to surface what is actually working, where real friction exists, and how the ground is shifting as teams build products, hire talent, navigate regulation, and scale. The focus is on lived operating experience shared honestly, peer to peer so founders leave with insight, not soundbites.

day20.Title: AI for Democracy: Reimagining Governance in the Age of Intelligence
day20.Name: Dr. Chinmay Pandya, SAIPR, India
day20.name: Kanishka Narayan MP, UK Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT)
day20.name_1: Mr. Lajos Oláh, Hungarian National Assembly
day20.name_3: Mr. Om Birla, Parliament of India
day20.Description_1: This session will examine the evolving role of AI in democratic systems. It will explore how AI can strengthen transparency, accountability, inclusion, and participatory decision-making while remaining grounded in constitutional values and human oversight. It will address applications in public administration and key risks, including bias, privacy, surveillance, and power imbalances, to advance responsible, trust-based AI adoption.
day20.Description_4: Ms. Jimena Sofía Viveros Álvarez, HumAIn Foundation

day20.Title: Democratizing AI Requires a Free and Open Internet
day20.Name: Matthew Prince, Cloudflare
day20.name: Rahul Matthan, Trilegal
day20.name_1: Rajan Anandan, PeakXV Partners and Surge
day20.Description_1: As AI becomes deeply embedded in economies and societies, the key question is who has access and who benefits. This session brings thought leaders to discuss how true AI democratization depends on preserving the Internet as a global platform rather than fragmented walled gardens. It will explore how open-source ecosystems, data commons, and distributed compute powered by an open Internet can enable startups and developing nations, especially India, to realize inclusive "AI for All" ambitions.

day20.Title: Trust and Safety as Engines for Growth and Innovation
day20.Name: Alexandra Reeve Givens, IAPP
day20.name: Commissioner John Edwards, United Kingdom Government
day20.Description_1: Around the world governments and businesses agree: trust is the key for accelerating AI adoption. While research has extensively mapped why trust in AI matters, far less attention has been given to how trust will be implemented, including issues around the people, skills and systems required to operationalize trust and safety at scale.

day20.Title: Building Inclusive Futures through AI Literacy for India and the Global South
day20.Name: Bhanu Potta, Central Square Foundation
day20.name: Chitra Ravi, Chrysalis
day20.name_1: Dr. Shabana KM, Wadhwani School of Data Science and AI, IIT Madras
day20.Description_1: This session will examine how AI can be integrated into education in India and the Global South in a responsible, inclusive, and scalable way. It will address the need for foundational AI literacy, clarify what AI literacy means for students, teachers, and parents, and explore practical pathways from curriculum design to classroom implementation. The discussion will also focus on governance, ethics, data privacy, and system-level conditions for safe, large-scale innovation in schools.

day20.Title: AI Capacity Building - Scaling Knowledge, Driving Innovation
day20.Name: Dr. Mohammed Misbahuddin, C-DAC Bangalore
day20.name: Dr. S D Sudarsan, C-DAC Bangalore
day20.name_1: Mr. Ramesh Naidu Laveti, C-DAC Bangalore
day20.Description_1: As AI rapidly reshapes education and research, academic institutions face growing challenges in integrating AI literacy, advanced skills, and ethical readiness into curricula and research programs. This workshop addresses these challenges by bringing together academic leaders, researchers, and standards bodies to explore scalable, interoperable frameworks for AI capacity building.
day20.Description_3: Indo-Pacific European Hub for Digital Partnerships (INPACE)

day20.Title: Towards a Safer South: Launch of the Global South Network on AI Safety and Evaluation
day20.Name: Ambassador Philip Thigo, Government of Kenya
day20.name: Dr Amandeep Singh Gill, United Nations
day20.name_3: Dr Rachel Adams, Global Centre on AI Governance
day20.Description_1: The session will launch the Global South Network on AI Safety & Evaluation — a global alliance of research and civil society organisations working to advance context-aware AI safety research and practice rooted in realities of the Global South. It will explore how AI safety priorities differ across Global South contexts, where South-South collaboration is most needed, and how evidence from deployment contexts across the Global South can strengthen global AI safety efforts.

day20.Title: Artificial General Intelligence: A New Paradigm of Safety, Security, Privacy, Ethics, and Governance
day20.Name: Mr. Atul Kumar, Government Initiatives & Global Trade . DSCI
day20.name: Mr. Avneesh Pandey, SEBI
day20.Description_1: Artificial general intelligence will intensify existing challenges around safety, security, privacy, ethics, and governance. This session will examine how current trajectories in advanced AI raise near-term governance questions, particularly for developing economies. It will explore institutional readiness, policy gaps, and risk pathways across data, compute, markets, and deployment contexts, and will surface practical considerations for anticipatory governance that can inform responsible decision-making before irreversible dependencies take hold.
day20.Description_4: Mr. Vinayak Godse, Data Security Council of India

day20.Title: AI for Impact: Skilling, Inspiring, and Empowering the Next Gen
day20.Name: Mr.  Pankaj Kumar Pandey, Principal Secretary to Government, Department of Personnel & Administrative Reforms (e-Governance) and Director, Sakala Mission, Karnataka Government Secretariat
day20.name: Mr. Aman Jain, Meta
day20.name_1: Mr. Buddha Chandrasekhar, Anuvadini AI ; CCO, AICTE
day20.name_2: Mr. Darrin Farrant, United Nations Information Centre, India & Bhutan
day20.name_3: Mr. Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog
day20.Description_1: This session brings together policymakers, academia, and industry leaders to discuss how AI skilling can prepare the workforce for the future AI-led economy. It will explore India's approaches to developing AI talent, strategies for scaling and replicating successful skilling programs across the Global South, and ways to inspire the next generation to create impactful AI solutions for society. This session will aid in gaining insights into building inclusive, scalable AI skilling initiatives that drive innovation and social progress.

day20.Title: Thriving with AI: Human Potential, Skills, and Opportunity
day20.Name: Chris Lehane, OpenAI
day20.name: Iqbal Dhaliwal, J-PAL
day20.Description_1: AI is rapidly reshaping economies and societies. This panel will examine AI's socio-economic impact on productivity, growth, and with a particular focus on economic opportunity and the evolving role of education and skills. By engaging candidly with both risks and opportunities, the discussion will consider how aligning technology, education, and policy can help shape an AI-driven economy that delivers resilient and sustainable solutions.

day20.Title: Shaping the Semiconductor Workforce in the Age of AI
day20.Name: David Fried, Lam Research
day20.name: Mr Amitesh Sinha, India Semiconductor Mission
day20.Description_1: A discussion with senior Government officials, academia, and industry leadership on building scalable and holistic workforce frameworks to support the semiconductor industry and the next generation of AI-powered technologies.
day20.Description_4: Mr Saurabh Chandorkar, Centre for Nanoscience And Engineering, IISC

day20.Title: The Intelligent Image: How AI Is Transforming Filmmaking
day20.Name: Manu Anand, Visual Storyteller
day20.name: Rahul Regulapati, Galleri5
day20.Description_1: A curated conversation bringing together filmmakers, creators, marketers, and tech leaders to explore how GenAI is reshaping storytelling, culture, and commerce. The session uses live case studies while examining how platforms, creators, and AI together are birthing the next generation of IP, franchises, and cultural movements.

day20.Title: Embedded Governance for AI in Finance: An India-First, Risk-Based Policy Dialogue
day20.Name: Kazim Rizvi, The Dialogue
day20.name: Priyanka Jain, Fi Money
day20.name_1: Vikram Kishore Bhattacharya, Amazon Web Services
day20.Description_1: This panel discussion will bring together regulators, financial institutions, and fintech stakeholders to examine how risk-based, embedded governance frameworks for artificial intelligence can be designed and operationalised within India's financial ecosystem. The discussion will focus on approaches to balancing innovation with trust, accountability, and supervisory oversight across emerging AI use cases in credit, payments, fraud detection, and compliance.

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Ranvir Sachdeva, TEDx speaker & ITU160 Ambassador

day20.Title: Panel
day20.Name: Salil Parekh, Chief Executive Officer, Infosys
day20.name: K. Krithivasan, Chief Executive Officer, Tata Consultancy Services
day20.name_1: C Vijayakumar, Chief Executive Officer & Managing Director, HCL Technologies
day20.name_2: Arundhati Bhattacharya, Chairperson & Chief Executive Officer, Salesforce India
day20.name_3: Moderator: Amitabh Kant, Former Chief Executive Officer, NITI Aayog

day20.Title: Panel: Next Generation of Techies
day20.Name: Arvind Jain, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Glean
day20.name: Navrina Singh, Founder & Chief Executive Officer, Credo AI
day20.name_1: Bipul Sinha, Chairman, Co-Founder & CEO, Rubrik
day20.name_2: Malhar Bhide, Chief Technology Officer, Origin Bio
day20.name_3: Deepak Pathak, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer, Skild AI
day20.Description_4: Moderator: Anirudh Suri, Managing Partner, India Internet Fund

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Lt Gen Vipul Shinghal, AVSM, SM Deputy Chief of the Army Staff (Information Systems & Training)

day20.Title: Harnessing the AI Revolution for Social Empowerment
day20.Name: Mr. Anurag Behar, Azim Premji Foundation
day20.name: Ms. Julie Delahanty, International Development Research Centre (IDRC), Canada
day20.name_2: Ms. Sandhya Ramachandran Arun, Wipro Limited
day20.Description_1: This panel examines how the rapid scale and speed of artificial intelligence adoption is reshaping work, employment, and skill requirements, with a strong focus on inclusive and responsible AI. The discussion brings together diverse perspectives to explore what is required to ensure AI is developed and deployed in ways that minimise labour market disruptions, strengthen workforce resilience, and advance social empowerment - particularly for vulnerable and transitioning worker populations.

day20.Title: Toward Collective Action: A Roundtable on Safe and Trusted AI
day20.Name: Chinasa T. Okolo, TechneCultura . United Nations office for digital and emerging technologies
day20.name: Kola Ijasan, Research ICT Africa
day20.name_1: Mark Gaffley, Global Centre on Governance
day20.name_2: Mark Gaffley, Global Centre on Governance
day20.Description_1: This roundtable brings together African policymakers, researchers, civil society, and innovation leaders to discuss safe and trusted AI governance. The focus will be on implementing commitments, enhancing coordination, and addressing underexplored risks, such as cyber, bio, and loss-of-control threats. The session will include opening reflections, a moderated panel, and an interactive Q&A to share insights and identify collaboration pathways, contributing to the India AI Impact Summit outcomes.

day20.Title: Preparing to Monitor the Impacts of Agents: Closing the Global Assurance Divide for Safe and Trusted AI
day20.Name: Chris Meserole, Frontier Model Forum
day20.name: Doreen Bogdan-Martin, International Telecommuni cation Union (ITU)
day20.Description_1: This 60-minute panel session examines how real-time monitoring and threshold-based safety frameworks can be applied to govern AI agents at scale. It explores inclusive AI assurance approaches that support safe, trusted, and interoperable deployment across diverse global contexts.

day20.Title: Unpacking Openness and Trust in AI: Global Perspectives
day20.Name: Alondra Nelson, Princeton University
day20.name: Amba Kak, AI Now
day20.Description_1: This high-level panel explores a central tension in AI governance: openness can enable collaboration, innovation, and trust, yet may be constrained by commercial, state, and security considerations. The session examines how openness can function across the AI stack - compute, data, models, APIs, and applications and how to prevent misleading claims of openness. The panel also aims to highlight meaningful openness for emerging economies, balancing innovation, intellectual property, and national security.
day20.Description_4: Ravneet Kaur, Competition Commission of India

day20.Title: Protecting Global Citizens by Securing Communications with AI
day20.Name: Anshuman Kar, Tanla Platform Limited
day20.name: Ratan Kumar Kesh, Bandhan Bank
day20.Description_1: This session showcases the "Made in India" Wisely AI solution where the burden of fending off the fraudster is moved from the individual to the intelligent network core. This discussion will explore the regulatory, technical, and business dimensions of deploying AI-led security at a national scale.

day20.Title: Shaping the AI Narrative: Trust, Outcomes and Responsibility
day20.Name: Divyesh Vithlani, First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB)
day20.name: Erik Ekudden, Ericsson
day20.name_2: Hon. Dr. Andrew Charlton MP, Science, Technology and the Digital Economy Government of Australia
day20.Description_1: As AI adoption accelerates, enterprises are assessing how the next wave of transformation differs from earlier expectations. This session brings together investors, founders, and transformation leaders to examine where enterprise AI can create value, where limitations remain, and how organisations can move from pilot initiatives to scaled deployment. The discussion will also consider how operating models may evolve in response to emerging AI-enabled workflows.

day20.Title: Enterprise-Grade Responsible AI for India and the Global South
day20.Name: Anupam Chattopadhyay, College of Computing & Data Science, NTU Singapore
day20.name: Babak Hodjat, Cognizant
day20.Description_1: For India and the Global South, as AI systems move from pilots to mission-critical deployment across enterprises and governments, this challenge is amplified by fragmented and heterogeneous data, legacy IT infrastructure, uneven regulatory maturity, multilingual and culturally diverse populations, and high-impact use cases in finance, healthcare, welfare delivery, and public services. This session will examine what enterprise-grade responsible AI looks like in such contexts, grounded in real deployments rather than abstract frameworks.

day20.Title: Leveraging AI4All: Pathways to Inclusion
day20.Name: Agustya Mehta, Meta
day20.name: Archana Joshi, Xoriant
day20.name_2: Hoda Baraka, The Egyptian Minister of ICT for Technology Talents Development, Egypt
day20.Description_1: This session brings together leaders from government, industry, the judiciary, and international institutions to showcase how India is deploying AI for population-scale, citizen-centric impact. The session examines real-world inclusion successes across accessibility, language, and service delivery, and explores how India's experience can inform global collaboration, capacity building, and inclusive AI adoption across the world.

day20.Title: Keynote
day20.Name: Sara Hooker, Co-founder, Adaption Labs

day20.Name:
Dr Pramod Varma 
 Co-founder & Chief Architect, 
 Networks for Humanity (NFH)

day20.Name: SGK Kishore, Executive officer and Chief Innovation Officer, GMR
day20.name: Vineet Mittal, Chairman, Avaada Group
day20.name_1: Natham Blom, Vice President, Cooling, Chemours
day20.name_2: Moderator: Arunabha Ghosh, Chief Executive Officer, Council on Energy, Environment and Water

day20.Title: Panel: AI in DPI
day20.Name: Robert Opp, Chief Digital Officer, UNDP
day20.name: Dr. Hans Wijayasuriya, Chief Advisor to President of Sri Lanka on Digital Economy, Sri Lanka
day20.name_1: Saibal Chakraborty, Managing Director and Senior Partner, BCG
day20.name_2: Sangbu Kim, Vice President for Digital, World Bank
day20.name_3: Moderator: CV Madhukar, Chief Executive Officer, Co-Develop
